block.p: Alison Walker Jahncke, a daughter of Elizabeth C. Jahncke and P. Roger Jahncke of New York, was married yesterday to Per Stefan Strandlund, the son of Lizzie Ingegard Hasth Strandlund and Sven E. Strandlund of Hoganas, Sweden. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Episcopal Church in Southampton, N.Y.
The bride, 30, and the bridegroom, 32, work in Hong Kong, where she is an editor for Bloomberg News and he is the financial manager of Hop Lun (Hong Kong), a women's clothing manufacturer.

Alison Walker Jahncke, a daughter of Elizabeth C. Jahncke and P. Roger Jahncke of New York, was married yesterday to Per Stefan Strandlund, the son of Lizzie Ingegard Hasth Strandlund and Sven E. Strandlund of Hoganas, Sweden. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Episcopal Church in Southampton, N.Y.
The bride, 30, and the bridegroom, 32, work in Hong Kong, where she is an editor for Bloomberg News and he is the financial manager of Hop Lun (Hong Kong), a women's clothing manufacturer.

The bride is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia. Her father is a partner in Ernst & Young, the accounting firm, in New York.
Mr. Strandlund, who is known as Stefan, graduated from Brunel University, in England. His father retired as a sales manager in Ghent, Belgium, for the Cyprus Industrial Minerals Company.
The couple met in 1982, as students at the International School of Brussels.
